official-title.#text:
To provide for the transfer of certain
		  public land currently administered by the Bureau of Land Management to the
		  administrative jurisdiction of the Secretary of the Navy for inclusion in Naval
		  Air Weapons Station China Lake, California, and for other
		  purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on

, for a
			 period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for
			 consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the
			 committee concerned

short-title.#text:
Naval Air Weapons Station China Lake
			 Security Enhancement Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Transfer of
			 administrative jurisdiction, Naval Air Weapons Station China Lake,
			 California

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall transfer to the
			 administrative jurisdiction of the

certain public land
			 administered by the

in Inyo, Kern, and San Bernardino
			 Counties, California, consisting of approximately 1,045,000 acres in Inyo,
			 Kern, and San Bernardino Counties, California, as generally depicted on the map
			 titled

quote.#text: Naval Air Weapons Station China Lake Withdrawal - Renewal

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Naval Air Weapons Station China Lake Security Enhancement Act/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall include the land as
			 part of the Naval Air Weapons Station China Lake, California, and authorize use
			 of the land for military purposes.

text.#text:
Upon the receipt of the
			 land under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall publish in the Federal Register a legal description and map
			 of the public land to be transferred under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Naval Air Weapons Station China Lake Security Enhancement Act/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 have the same force and effect as if included in this Act, except that the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Naval Air Weapons Station China Lake Security Enhancement Act/s:2/ss:c/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may correct errors in the legal description and
			 map.

text.#text: The legal description and map filed under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be made without reimbursement, except that the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Naval Air Weapons Station China Lake Security Enhancement Act/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for any
			 costs incurred by the

to prepare the legal
			 description and map under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Naval Air Weapons Station China Lake Security Enhancement Act/s:2/ss:c

text.#text:
Nothing in this Act
			 shall be construed—

to establish a
			 reservation in favor of the United States with respect to any water or water
			 right on lands transferred by this Act; or

to authorize the
			 appropriation of water on lands transferred by this Act except in accordance
			 with applicable State law.

This section shall not be
			 construed to affect any water rights acquired or reserved by the United States
			 before the date of the enactment of this Act.

header.#text:
Effect on previously
			 acquired or reserved water rights

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is withdrawn from all forms of
			 appropriation under the public land laws, including the mining laws and
			 geothermal leasing laws, so long as the lands remain under the administrative
			 jurisdiction of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Naval Air Weapons Station China Lake Security Enhancement Act/s:2

text.#text:
Subject to valid existing rights, the public
			 land to be transferred under
